intro: Chuquiraga seleriana, commonly known as the Andean burr or chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique appearance and adaptations make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
